content.raw:
when testing pull requests that modify dsl files, we have to deploy the dsl files to update the jobs. it will often last less than 24 hours because there is a nightly job that will regenerate the dsl from default if there have been any commits to default (even to non-dsl files)

this is the root job:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/

but during testing, I often just trigger the relevant jobs; in this case it would be the following:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_ariac/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo_ros_pkgs/

do you want to try triggering those two dsl jobs and then re-run the other ones?
content.html:
when testing pull requests that modify dsl files, we have to deploy the dsl files to update the jobs. it will often last less than 24 hours because there is a nightly job that will regenerate the dsl from default if there have been any commits to default (even to non-dsl files)

this is the root job:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/

but during testing, I often just trigger the relevant jobs; in this case it would be the following:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_ariac/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo_ros_pkgs/

do you want to try triggering those two dsl jobs and then re-run the other ones?
